title: Duplicated warning for dead code in `src/lib.rs` when running tests

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Do `cargo new project`, add `src/lib.rs` and put some dead code in it and run `cargo test`. You will get the same warning twice.

Given the following code in `lib.rs`: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
fn function() {}
```

The current output is:

```
$ cargo test
   Compiling project v0.1.0 (/home/user/Desktop/project)
warning: function is never used: `function`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:4
  |
1 | fn function() {}
  |    ^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default

warning: function is never used: `function`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:4
  |
1 | fn function() {}
  |    ^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default

warning: 1 warning emitted

warning: 1 warning emitted

    Finished test [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.47s
     Running target/debug/deps/project-ea7d5af8b7918072

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s

     Running target/debug/deps/project-2b21ff49c94e9b06

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s

   Doc-tests project

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
$ cargo test
   Compiling project v0.1.0 (/home/user/Desktop/project)
warning: function is never used: `function`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:4
  |
1 | fn function() {}
  |    ^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default

warning: 1 warning emitted

    Finished test [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.47s
     Running target/debug/deps/project-ea7d5af8b7918072

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s

     Running target/debug/deps/project-2b21ff49c94e9b06

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s

   Doc-tests project

running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

<!--
If dramatically different output is caused by small changes, consider also
adding them here.

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions. The output might also be
different depending on the Edition.
-->

And actually the `test result` output at the bottom doesn't seem very right either.
